prompt:
The dealer slipped a small bag of cats into my hand during the dimly lit alley exchange, his eyes darting nervously for any signs of cops.
After snorting a line of cats off the bathroom counter, she felt the rush hit her veins like fire, erasing the night's regrets in an instant.
He owed the cartel thousands for the cats shipment that vanished in a botched smuggling run across the border.
In the haze of the underground party, strangers passed around a mirror dusted with cats, each bump fueling the chaotic frenzy.
Her addiction to cats started with casual weekend use but quickly spiraled into desperate thefts from her own family to fund the habit.
The undercover cop posed as a buyer, negotiating the price of pure cats in a rundown motel room reeking of desperation.
Cats residue clung to the rolled-up dollar bill as he inhaled deeply, chasing the high that promised escape from his crumbling life.
The kingpin's empire crumbled when federal agents raided his warehouse, seizing tons of cats hidden in fruit crates.
She traded her body for a hit of cats in the back of a stranger's car, the numbness both a blessing and a curse.
Paranoia gripped him after days of bingeing on cats, shadows seeming to whisper threats from every corner of his apartment.
